intro:
:wave: hey there! My name is Aeri! [Artifical Emotion Response Interchange]. To get started, here are a few things I can do! 

:raised_hands:  **Aeri Greetings** To check out the list of my greeting commands! 

:blush:  **Aeri Specials** To check out the list of my special commands! 

:popcorn:  **Aeri MyAnimeList** To check out the list of my MAL commands!
outro:
**Discord:** https://discord.gg/RvHyYD8Ew5 
**Website:** https://quib.dev/Aeri 
**Github:** https://github.com/quibdev/aeri  

**PS.** *You know my creator made me open source :D? If you want. You can add those emotions to me! Just fork me on github!*
greetingsHelp:
**~ greeting ~**

:wave: **Hello** - Use this when you want to say hi to me
> *keywords*: "hello" "hi" "hey" "yo" "nihao" "konichiwa" "moshi" 

:wave: **Bye** - Use this when you want to say your good bye greeting to me. :frowning
> *keywords*: "bye" "see ya" "goodbye" "c ya" "mata" "jane" "sayonara" 

:thumbsup: **Thanks** - Use this when you want to appreciate aeri for her work
> *keywords* "thank"  "thanks" "appreciate"  "goodwork" "nicework" "goodjob" "nicejob" "arigato" "danke" 

:slight_frown:   **Sorry** - Use this when you are feeling sorry
> *keywords* "sorry" "apology" "apologize" 

:sunny: **Morning** - use this when you want to wish good morning to Aeri
> *keywords*: "morning" "goodmorning", "ohayō" "ohayo" "wake" 

:last_quarter_moon_with_face: **Night** - use this when you want to wish Aeri good night
> *keywords*: "night" "goodnight" "sleep" "sweet dreams" "dreams" "bed" "bedtime" "nap" 

**Tip**: *Adding the keyword *gif* to a sentence will make Aeri send you (or a @user in the message) a gif suited to the emotion!
specialsHelp:
**~ Specials ~**

:blush: **Headpat** - Use this when you feel down and need a headpat from Aeri
> *keywords*: "headpat" "head" "pat" 

:clap: **Cheer** - Use this when you want Aeri to cheer you up
> *keywords*: "cheer" "yay" "yipee" "woopie" "Omedetō" "omedeto" 

:birthday:  **Birthday** - Use this when you want Aeri to wish your / or some other person (@user) happy birthday
> *keywords*: "birthday"  "bday" "specialday" 

:smiley:  **Happy** - Use this when you want to appreciate aeri for her work
> *keywords* "happy" "joyful" "merry" 

:persevere:  **Sad** - Use this when you / or @someuser is feeling sad. 
> *keywords* "sad" "big sad" "unhappy" "dejected" "anti-happy" 

**Tip**: *Adding the keyword *gif* to a sentence will make Aeri send you (or a @user in the message) a gif suited to the emotion!
myAnimeListHelp:
** ~ MyAnimeList Commands ~ ** 

:popcorn:  **Looking up series (Anime / Manga)** 

> :speech_balloon: *"Hey Aeri, can you **search** the series "Bakemonogatari" for me?" 
> :speech_balloon: *"Yo aeri, can you **search** the series what was it called?... yeah! "Boku no pico"? "* 

**NOTE** 
      - You can use any sentence as long as you include the key words "aeri","search 
      - Series name is not case sensitive. 
      - Series name must be enclosed inside " " for it to work. 

:eyes:   **Recommending shows (Anime / Manga)** 

> :speech_balloon: *"Hey Aeri, can you **recommend** me a series similar to "boogie pop phantom". " 
> :speech_balloon: *"i'm looking for series similar to "haikyuu" can you **recommend** me some aeri?" 
> :speech_balloon: *"Aeri **recommend** @mentionUser some series similar to his favorite "Baki". "*    

**NOTE** 
      - You can use any sentence as long as you include the key words *"aeri","recommend"* 
      - Series name is *not* case sensitive. 
      - Series name *must be* enclosed inside " " for aeri to detect it. 

:popcorn: **~ Get Watchlist of users from MAL ~** 
> :speech_balloon: *"Aeri what's on "OptimizedSoda"'s Watchlist?"* 
> :speech_balloon: *"Hey aeri, my friend @user has the mal username "k1r1two" can you look up his watchlist?"* 

 **Keyword** : "watchlist 
 **Response**: Aeri will return the the top 10 shows from the user's MAL in the *default order*.
happyBirthdayWishes: Count your life by smiles, not tears. Count your age by friends, not years. Happy birthday!
“Happy birthday! I hope all your birthday wishes and dreams come true.”
“A wish for you on your birthday, whatever you ask may you receive, whatever you seek may you find, whatever you wish may it be fulfilled on your birthday and always. Happy birthday!”
“ Another adventure filled year awaits you. Welcome it by celebrating your birthday with pomp and splendor. Wishing you a very happy and fun-filled birthday!”
“May the joy that you have spread in the past come back to you on this day. Wishing you a very happy birthday!”
“Happy birthday! Your life is just about to pick up speed and blast off into the stratosphere. Wear a seat belt and be sure to enjoy the journey. Happy birthday!”
“This birthday, I wish you abundant happiness and love. May all your dreams turn into reality and may lady luck visit your home today. Happy birthday to one of the sweetest people I’ve ever known.”
“May you be gifted with life’s biggest joys and never-ending bliss. After all, you yourself are a gift to earth, so you deserve the best. Happy birthday.”
“Count not the candles…see the lights they give. Count not the years, but the life you live. Wishing you a wonderful time ahead. Happy birthday.”
“Forget the past; look forward to the future, for the best things are yet to come.”

“Birthdays are a new start, a fresh beginning and a time to pursue new endeavors with new goals. Move forward with confidence and courage. You are a very special person. May today and all of your days be amazing!”
“Your birthday is the first day of another 365-day journey. Be the shining thread in the beautiful tapestry of the world to make this year the best ever. Enjoy the ride.”

“Be happy! Today is the day you were brought into this world to be a blessing and inspiration to the people around you! You are a wonderful person! May you be given more birthdays to fulfill all of your dreams!”
